intro: Roemeria carica, commonly known as the European roemeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and compound leaves with a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Roemeria carica is native to southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
